definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]
paper hot pot (hot pot using a single-use pot made of Japanese washi paper with a special coating to prevent burning and leaking, used for cooking at the dining table)

sentences.english: In the evening I enjoyed the hot pot with my friends.
sentences.chinese: 晚上又和朋友打了一会儿火锅。

sentences.english: How about we go for hotpot dinner ?
The tot likes to eat hot pot.
sentences.chinese: 这个小朋友喜欢吃火锅。

sentences.english: The Hot pot from Sichuan, and Shen jian bao from Shanghai have become two of those "must-haves".
sentences.chinese: 中国的四川麻辣火锅和上海生煎包榜上有名。

sentences.english: I like some vinegar when I having hot-pot .
sentences.chinese: 我在吃火锅的时候喜欢来一点醋。

sentences.english: Some hot pot restaurants use paraffin instead of butter.
sentences.chinese: 有些火锅店用石蜡替代牛油。

sentences.english: I am really in the mood for a spicy hotpot.
sentences.chinese: 我真的很有兴趣吃麻辣火锅。

sentences.english: Hot pot is the best thing to have on a cold winter night.
sentences.chinese: 冷飕飕的冬夜最适合吃火锅了。

sentences.english: What could be better on a numbingly cold winter night than a hot pot to warm your heart?
sentences.chinese: 严寒冬日，有什么能比火锅更暖人心呢？

sentences.english: I and my classmate are going to eat chaffy dish together tonight, then sing songs. so cool!
sentences.chinese: 今晚和同学约了去吃火锅，再去唱歌，真爽。

sentences.english: The quality of cooking oil in the process of repeated boiling of huoguo(hot pot)seasoning mate- rial was monitored.
sentences.chinese: 研究了火锅底料熬煮过程中油脂质量的变化。

sentences.english: Best Chinese Seafood & Hotpot restaurant in New Saigon City Centre Phu My Hung area.
sentences.chinese: 胡志明市新城区富美兴最好的中餐海鲜火锅酒家。

sentences.english: I like food with strong taste. So I like Sichuan food… Hot pot is my favourite.
sentences.chinese: 我口重，所以喜欢川菜，火锅是我的最爱。

sentences.english: The soup that mom cooked tastes very good!
sentences.chinese: 煮火锅时用白汤煮味道很鲜。

definition: see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]
hot spicy soup (often sold in street stalls)
"mandarin ducks" pot (hot pot with a divider, containing spicy soup on one side, mild soup on the other)
duck's blood and beef tripe in spicy soup
to rinse/to trick/to fool sb/to cook by dipping finely sliced ingredients briefly in boiling water or soup (generally done at the dining table)
Sichuan poached sliced fish in hot chili oil
